snippet: Masahiro Tanaka led the Rakuten Eagles, who play in Sendai, a city ravaged by the 2011 earthquake and tsunami, to the Japan Series title last season.
abstract: Yozo Tachibana, president of Japan's Rakuten Eagles, at MLB's winter meetings, says no decision had been made on whether to post pitcher Masahiro Tanaka; makes it clear that Eagles are unhappy that new posting system, expected to be approved by MLB’s executive committee, establishes maximum posting fee of $20 million; under old system, Eagles could have expected bids of $50 million or more.
lead_paragraph: Masahiro Tanaka led the Rakuten Eagles, who play in Sendai, a city ravaged by the 2011 earthquake and tsunami, to the Japan Series title last season.

headline.main: New Posting System Likely to Delay, Not Sink, Sale of a Japanese Ace
headline.print_headline: New Posting System Likely to Delay, Not Sink, Sale of a Japanese Ace
